It was Tuesday, which meant Summer had been moved in for nearly four weeks by the time of the unboxing. After an hour of breaking down, she sat between two towers. One was labeled summer clothes. The other, winter. She sat on the hardwood floor and looked at the spine of that one book that stared back. She unclasped her fingers from her shins and stood up. She walked to the shelf at the far wall and pulled the one apart from the others. She turned the hard cover towards the window and flipped the pages to where the Letter S bent towards the margin. His handwriting was nice. It had this italicized quality to it that made every written word look a little bit more romantic. Romantic, yet unsure. She wasn't sure, but she thought she knew why he had given it to her.
